text.p: These are the leading stories in the Mozambican press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- Cashew-shelling companies and trade unions on Wednesday warned that Mozambique's cashew processing industry is in imminent danger of a total shutdown. At a Maputo seminar, they blamed the government for bowing to World Bank pressure to strip the processing industry of protection, stimulating the export of unshelled nuts.

- The Mozambican and United States governments on Wednesday signed an agreement in Maputo under which $15 million worth of US commercial food aid will be supplied to Mozambique over the next three years.

- The 1993 world 800-metres champion, Mozambique's Maria Mutola, sets her sights on regaining the title, after winning her heat at the World Championships in Athens on Wednesday. She will run in the semi-finals on Thursday.
